name: Alexander Alekhine
bio: Born in Moscow in 1892, Alexander Alekhine has long been considered to be one of the greatest chess players of all time. He became world chess champion in 1927 by defeating the legendary Jose Raul Capablanca. Alekhine lost this title in 1935, and then regained it in 1937. Alexander Alekhine passed away in 1946, and remains the only World Chess Champion to die while holding the title.
